footer.p1: Gujarat is a land of great warriors, saints and many great personalities. In one small town of such great land a divine, capable and dedicated soul known as Shri MAHAPATRA (Shri Vitthalbhai)
footer.p2: was born, who has charismatic personality. His deeds and efforts created such a vast atmosphere of reverence, divinity and light.

symbols.title: " The symbols of the Dham "
symbols.text1: The Kalash-Shriphal represents purity, auspicious beginnings, and the rise of a new spiritual era. It holds the essence of Sattvik energy that nurtures harmony, prosperity, and universal welfare. Under the divine guidance of Maa Vishwambhari, it symbolizes the sacred foundation of a brighter world.
symbols.text2: The sacred Mashaal symbolizes divine light, truth, and the awakening of revolutionary thought. Its flame dispels darkness and inspires courage, clarity, and transformation. Guided by Maa Vishwambhari, it represents the eternal fire that leads humanity toward righteousness and higher consciousness.
symbols.text3: The preservation, nourishment, and destruction of the universe are managed by the Tridev. The symbols Om, the flag, and the trishul clearly convey the message of the entire creation being governed by the Supreme Power — Maa Vishvambhari.
symbols.text4: also This Kalash-Shriphal is the supreme symbol of Sattvik, which symbolizes the auspicious beginning of world welfare and the creation of a new age under the divine guidance of Shri Mahapatra.
symbols.text5: This torch is the divine flame of Maa Vishvambhari's revolutionary ideology, becoming a powerful symbol of the welfare of all humanity and the divine creation of a new era.
symbols.text6: The preservation, nourishment, and destruction of the universe are managed by the Tridev. The symbols Om, the flag, and the trishul clearly convey the message of the entire creation being governed by the Supreme Power — Maa Vishvambhari.
